name: 人力資源發展研究
description:
COURSE DESCRIPTION & OBJECTIVES 
This course discusses theoretical foundations and practical aspects of human resource development (HRD) and its relation with organizational management. The purpose of this course is to help students understand history, definitions, implementation, and issues of HRD. Through lecture, group discussion, case study, and field interview, the course aims to develop students’ knowledge, abilities, and skills for conducting HRD in various types of organizations. 
More specifically, upon successful completion of this course, the student will be able to: 
1.Understand the theoretical foundations of HRD
2.Familiar with the major processes of HRD
3.Gain insights about the practices of HRD in various businesses and organizations
4.Develop the skills in analyzing, designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating programs of HRD

syllabus:
Course Objectives:

      This course discusses human resource development (HRD) and its relation with organizational management. The purpose of this course is to help students understand theoretical concepts, practical implementation, and critical issues on HRD. Through lecture, group discussion, case study, and project practice, this course aims to develop students’ knowledge, abilities, and skills for conducting HRD in various types of organizations.

**Course Content:** 

Course Overview & Introduction

Psychological Foundations of HRD

System Theory and HRD

Adult Learning Theory and Application in HRD

Management and Leadership in HRD

Organizational Culture and HRD: The Roots, the Landscape, and the Future

Work on your Mid-term

Competence: Bases for Employee Effectiveness

\[Mid-term project presentation\]

Workplace Learning

\[Mid-term project presentation\]

International and Cross-Cultural Perspectives of HRD

Coaching

Talent Management as a Strategically Aligned Practice

Morality and Ethics in HRD
